Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is red-grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and light-brown in colour, the exterior is covered with a red-grey slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text finely written in black ink, containing a list of articles.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.121)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87631) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87631)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 141 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
